questions.question: What is the main difference between Random Search and Depth-First Search?

answers.a: Random Search always finds the shortest path.
answers.b: Random Search does not follow a systematic order, while DFS does.
answers.c: Random Search uses heuristics, while DFS does not.
answers.d: Random Search guarantees an optimal solution.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Random Search?

answers.c: A non-deterministic method that chooses paths randomly.
answers.d: A method that always explores all nodes.

questions.question: In Random Search, what happens if the algorithm reaches a dead-end?

answers.a: It backtracks systematically to the previous node.
answers.b: It chooses another path randomly from the start or remaining unexplored nodes.
answers.c: It terminates immediately without finding the goal.
answers.d: It guarantees finding the goal by retrying.

questions.question: Why is Random Search often considered as a baseline algorithm?

answers.a: Because it is the fastest algorithm for graph traversal.
answers.b: Because it ensures the most optimal path.
answers.c: Because it is simple and can be compared against advanced methods.
answers.d: Because it requires heuristics to work.

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of Random Search?

answers.a: It is too complex to implement.
answers.b: It cannot be applied to optimization problems.
answers.c: It may fail to find the goal or return a non-optimal path.
